questions.question: What does a flashing yellow traffic light signal mean?
options: Traffic light is out of order
questions.explanation: A flashing yellow light means proceed with caution, not stop.

questions.question: Who has the right of way when two vehicles approach an intersection at the same time?
questions.explanation: At an intersection where there is no stop sign, yield sign, or traffic signal, drivers must yield to vehicles coming from the right.

questions.question: What is the speed limit in a school zone unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: The speed limit is 25 mph in school zones, business, or residential districts unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: Where are you not allowed to park?
questions.explanation: You are not allowed to park in an intersection, on a hill, or next to a red curb. These are all dangerous or illegal places to park.

questions.question: What should you do when driving in fog?
questions.explanation: In fog, you should use your low beams because high beams will reflect off the fog and make it harder to see.

questions.question: What does a red 'X' displayed above a traffic lane mean?
questions.explanation: A red 'X' displayed above a traffic lane means that the lane is closed to traffic in your direction.

questions.question: When are you required to yield the right-of-way to pedestrians?
options: Only when they are in a marked crosswalk
Only when they are in an unmarked crosswalk
Only when traffic signals are not working
questions.explanation: You must yield the right-of-way to pedestrians at all times, regardless of whether they are in a marked or unmarked crosswalk.

questions.question: What is the speed limit on an interstate highway in New Jersey unless otherwise posted?
questions.explanation: The speed limit on an interstate highway in New Jersey is 65 mph unless otherwise posted.

questions.question: Which of the following is not a legal parking position?
questions.explanation: Double parking, or parking parallel to a car already parked at the curb, is illegal because it blocks traffic.

questions.question: What should you do if your vehicle starts to hydroplane?
questions.explanation: If your vehicle starts to hydroplane, you should ease off the accelerator. Do not brake hard or steer sharply as it could cause a skid.
